div.p: SECURIDACA, a plant belonging to the claſs of diadelphia, and to the order of octandria The calyx has three leaves, which are ſmall, deciduous, and coloured. The corolla is papilionaceous. The vexillum, conſiſting of two petals, is oblong, ſtraight, and conjoined to the carina at the baſe. The carina is of the ſame length with the alæ. The legumen is ovated, unilocular, monoſpermous, and ending in a ligulated ala. There are two ſpecies, the erecta and volubilis. The erecta has an upright item: the volubilis or ſcandens is a climbing plant, and is a native of the Weſt Indies.
